Pfeiffer began her acting career in the early 1980s with a small role in the TV movie "Blinded by the Light" (1980) and her breakout role in the 1983 film "Scarface." However, it was her portrayal of Cassidy in the 1983 comedy-drama "Grease 2" that truly marked her as a rising star.

Throughout the '80s and '90s, Pfeiffer became a prominent figure in Hollywood, garnering acclaim for her performances in films like "The Fabulous Baker Boys" (1989), for which she won a Golden Globe for Best Actress in a Motion Picture – Drama, and "Dangerous Liaisons" (1988). She also made her mark in the horror genre with her role as Dr. Susan Tyler in "Sleepwalkers" (1992) and in the action-comedy "Lethal Weapon 3" (1992).

Pfeiffer's work in the 1990s included leading roles in "White Oleander" (2002), "The Royal Tenenbaums" (2001), and the biographical films "Hairspray" (2007) and "Beaches" (1988), which earned her another Golden Globe for Best Actress.

Throughout her career, Pfeiffer has demonstrated her versatility as an actress, tackling both dramatic and comedic roles. She has worked with esteemed directors such as Sydney Pollack, David Lynch, and Martin Scorsese. In addition to her work in film, Pfeiffer has also made several appearances in television shows and is an accomplished singer, having released three albums.
